name: 柯萊恩
objective:
本課程旨在發展學生獨立規劃及從事研究的能力，學生可在指導老師的指導下，依個別的需求選擇研究的方向，訂定題目，並獨立完成研究計畫，撰寫報告。
專題研究範圍含：
實驗研究
量調查研究或質調查研究
個案研究
回溯研究
文化比較研究
理論闡述研究
schedule:
Week 1-4:  Keep reading primary and secondary source materials, keeping a journal of your insights.
At this point it will be useful to look over this journal in its entirety and compose a narrative of your exploration.  What methodologies have you employed.  How has your topic been shaped or reshaped by the very act of doing research and writing about it?  What have you discovered that is surprising to you?  Have you found any differences of opinion among critics, or ideas brought forth by a given critic with which you disagree?  Are there certain dominant critical ideas used in writing about your primary source?  How might you characterize them, broadly speaking?

Week 5-9:  Articulate what kind of approach or blend of approaches which suggest themselves to you to discuss your source (e.g., post-structuralist, Freudian, Jungian, anthropological, feminist, Marxist, phenomenological, philosophical, historical, etc.), and describe how this approach allows us a greater understanding of the source text, giving specific examples from your source text and keeping careful note of  (for example, if you have chosen to undertake a feminist reading of a novel) what other feminist scholars have also written about that novel.

Week 10-14:  Combine what you have written over the first semester with what you have written over the second semester.  Prepare an abstract  Prepare final presentation.  DUE:  TEN TO FIFTEEN PAGES MINIMUM, INCLUDING ABSTRACT, ILLUSTRATIONS (IF ANY) AND WORKS CITED PAGE AT END. 

Week 15-18:  Final editing details.  Rehearse oral/power point presentation.  SECOND SEMESTER FINAL COPY DUE DECEMBER 26, 2009.
scorePolicy:
1/4: Timeliness in meeting benchmarks (see Course Schedule below); journal responses

1/4: Collaborating with senior project adviser to devise efficacious writing strategies

1/4: Originality

1/4: Care in choosing and utilizing sources
